heading: lucent report: another winner
subheading: the telecom equipment giant beats street forecasts as revenues grow by one-third. also: microsoft has a friend.... cbs goes .com-hunting again.... china telecom prize on the line.... and more.
author: wired news report
text: lucent technologies doubled its profit in the latest quarter, beating wall street expectations in the process. the world's largest telecommunications equipment maker said thursday that, excluding charges, its profits increased to us$457 million, or 17 cents a share, compared with $186 million, or 7 cents a share, a year ago. the market research firm first call, which tracks analysts' estimates, had forecast earnings of 15 cents a share.also:microsoft has a friendcbs buys into office.comsun's zander promotedchina telecom bucks on the lineboeing rocket grounded (still)- - - - - -revenues increased 33 percent to $8.2 billion, compared with $6.2 billion in the year-ago quarter.lucent (lu) reiterated its bullish growth forecast for 1999 and said it would sell its us sales group that targets small and mid-sized businesses to a newly formed company led by susan mandl, the current chief executive of newcourt communications finance. terms of the sale were not disclosed.china securities built its ode to redmond thursday around the company's recently unveiled venus project – a cheap alternative to personal computers being developed for chinese consumers.the paper lauded microsoft (msft) for "creating a demand when people still did not have any demands, and for creating something convenient when no one was experiencing any inconvenience."the commentary concluded: "these methods are applicable to chinese enterprises which are moving towards a market economy."5. back to topmore .com hunting: continuing its internet buying spree, cbs announced thursday it would take a one-third stake in office.com in exchange for $42 million worth of promotion and advertising over the next six years.
